actor_awards.notes: Best known for his portrayal of the Tin Man in 'The Wizard of Oz' (1939). He received a Star on the Hollywood Walk of Fame for Radio.

filmography.title: The Wizard of Oz
filmography.role_description: A farmhand and his Oz counterpart, a man made of tin who desires a heart to feel emotion.
filmography.plot: Dorothy Gale is swept away from a farm in Kansas to a magical land of Oz in a tornado and embarks on a quest with her new friends to see the Wizard who can help her return home.

filmography.title: Poor Little Rich Girl
filmography.role_description: A radio performer who, along with his wife, takes in a lost wealthy child and includes her in their act.
filmography.plot: The daughter of a wealthy soap manufacturer gets lost and joins a vaudeville radio act, pretending to be poor.

filmography.title: Alexander's Ragtime Band
filmography.role_description: A drummer and songwriter who is part of the band led by the protagonist.
filmography.plot: A classical violinist rebels against his family and starts a jazz band, spanning several decades of music.

filmography.title: Rebecca of Sunnybrook Farm
filmography.role_description: A radio studio assistant who helps a talented young orphan get her big break.
filmography.plot: A talented orphan wins a radio audition to represent a breakfast cereal, but her family tries to keep her from performing.

filmography.title: Higher and Higher
filmography.role_description: A valet who devises a scheme to pass off a maid as a debutante to save his employer from bankruptcy.
filmography.plot: The servants of a bankrupt millionaire try to marry off a scullery maid to a rich man to save the household.

filmography.title: Moon Over Miami
filmography.role_description: A waiter at a Miami hotel who falls for the aunt of two gold-digging sisters.
filmography.plot: Two sisters and their aunt travel to Miami in search of rich husbands, pretending to be wealthy themselves.

filmography.title: Pigskin Parade
filmography.role_description: A newly hired college football coach who accidentally recruits a hillbilly melon-tosser as a star player.
filmography.plot: A small-town college football team gets an unexpected invitation to play against Yale.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Nomination – Best Supporting Actor (Stuart Erwin)

filmography.title: Wake Up and Live
filmography.role_description: A vaudeville performer with 'mic fright' who becomes a mysterious radio sensation.
filmography.plot: A singer who freezes in front of a microphone accidentally broadcasts a hit song while thinking the mic is off.

filmography.title: One Body Too Many
filmography.role_description: A timid insurance salesman who gets trapped in a mansion with eccentric relatives and a murderer.
filmography.plot: An insurance salesman tries to sell a policy to a millionaire, only to find him dead and the heirs disappearing one by one.

filmography.title: Scared Stiff
filmography.role_description: A reporter specializing in chess who stumbles into a murder mystery at a winery.
filmography.plot: A bumbling reporter gets mixed up in a murder investigation involving antique chess pieces.

filmography.title: People Are Funny
filmography.role_description: A radio producer who tries to bring a small-town show to the big leagues.
filmography.plot: Rival radio producers compete to bring a popular local show to a national audience.

filmography.title: Vacation in Reno
filmography.role_description: A husband who gets into a series of misunderstandings involving bank robbers after his wife leaves him.
filmography.plot: A man takes a vacation in Reno to forget his marital troubles but gets mistaken for a bank robber.

filmography.title: F-Man
filmography.role_description: An ambitious soda jerk who dreams of becoming a G-Man but settles for being an 'F-Man'.
filmography.plot: A young man wants to be a federal agent but isn't qualified, so he tries to solve a crime on his own.

filmography.title: Mister Cinderella
filmography.role_description: A barber who is mistaken for a millionaire and tries to keep up the charade.
filmography.plot: A barber is sent to a dinner party in place of a rich man and gets involved in high society schemes.

filmography.title: Sitting Pretty
filmography.role_description: One of two songwriters who hitchhike to Hollywood seeking fame and fortune.
filmography.plot: Two songwriters travel from New York to Hollywood, hoping to sell their music to the movies.

filmography.title: Pick a Star
filmography.role_description: A busboy who helps a young woman navigate Hollywood to become a star.
filmography.plot: A young woman goes to Hollywood to become a star and is helped by a busboy who loves her.

filmography.title: Danger - Love at Work
filmography.role_description: A young lawyer trying to get signatures from an eccentric family to sell a piece of land.
filmography.plot: A lawyer encounters a wacky family while trying to conduct a real estate transaction.

filmography.title: Navy Blues
filmography.role_description: A sailor who, along with his buddy, gets into trouble while trying to raise money.
filmography.plot: Two sailors accidentally enlist in the army and cause chaos during training.

filmography.title: Sing Your Worries Away
filmography.role_description: A songwriter who gets mixed up with gangsters trying to steal an inheritance.
filmography.plot: A songwriter and his suicidal partner get involved with a plan to inherit a fortune.

filmography.title: Follow Thru
filmography.role_description: A millionaire playboy who hires a golf pro to help a woman win a championship.
filmography.plot: A golf professional helps a young woman improve her game and her confidence to win a big match.

filmography.title: Norwood
filmography.role_description: The father of Joe Reese, appearing in this comedy road movie.
filmography.plot: A Vietnam veteran travels from Texas to New York to collect a debt and realize his dream of being a country singer.

filmography.title: New York, New York
filmography.role_description: A cameo appearance as a radio host/MC in this musical drama.
filmography.plot: An egotistical saxophone player and a young singer meet on V-J Day and embark on a strained and rocky romance.
filmography.awards: Golden Globe: Nomination – Best Motion Picture - Musical or Comedy

filmography.title: George White's 1935 Scandals
filmography.role_description: A performer in the revue-style musical featuring various acts.
filmography.plot: A musical revue film showcasing various vaudeville acts and musical numbers.

filmography.title: Hold That Co-ed
filmography.role_description: A politician who uses a college football team to boost his popularity.
filmography.plot: A governor decides to back a college football team to gain votes for his re-election campaign.

filmography.title: Here Comes the Groom
filmography.role_description: A man who gets involved in a scheme to fake a marriage.
filmography.plot: A man pretends to be a famous crooner to win the heart of a girl.
